title: Ticket #6840: Finish separation of read and write qmgmt commands
description:
In HTCondor 7.5.0 (#930), we separated the QMGMT_CMD cedar command into two commands, one for read-only operations (QMGMT_READ_CMD) and one for operations that modify the job queue (QMGMT_WRITE_CMD). For backwards compatibility, clients can still start a QMGMT_READ_CMD command (which is just QMGMT_CMD renamed) and then promote it to a connection that will modify the queue. This is needless complexity at this point, and it makes it harder for us to change the schedd to not handle any read-only requests in-process. We should complete the separation of these two cedar commands.

Most clients of the schedd now employ a version check and will use QMGMT_WRITE_CMD when wanting to modify the job queue. But a few don't do this. They always use QMGMT_READ_CMD for modification requests. They are condor_shadow.std, condor_prio, and condor_preen. We can assume that condor_shadow.std and condor_preen will be the same version as the schedd, but condor_prio with -name can have version skew. Thus, we need to be careful about when we make QMGMT_READ_CMD only work for read-only connections.
